page.title: 17SMEATHARPE - AMENITIES.
page.content: The nearest village shop is at Church- inford, and is a sub-post office as well. Many village shops have closed in the last 2O years as people shop in bulk, in town super-markets with comp- etitive prices. Smeatharpe has few amenities but even the public telephone box is under constant threat of closure. British Telecom, the private monopoly who owns the telephone service, continually reviews kiosks who have takings of less than Â£2OO per year. In the hot dry summers of 1976 and 1984, restrictions were imposed upon the use of water. This is when almost a million tourists visit the area. It seems incredible, with increasing water charges and the high rainfall in Devon, that this situation should occur. Obviously there are insuffic- ient reservoirs for the population.
